alert.note: Alert for Crosby; Garza; Lubbock; Lynn (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 12:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Lubbock, Lynn, Garza and southern Crosby Counties through 1230 PM CDT... At 1157 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of heavy rain showers and several strong thunderstorms containing torrential rain centered about 11 miles east of Tahoka, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Slaton, Post, Tahoka, Lake Alan Henry, O`Donnell, Kalgary, Caprock, Grassland, Southland, Justiceburg, Wilson and New Home. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
